author: wsjcom
title: In a Shutdown, What Part of the Federal Government Will Be Working and What Won’t Be
text:
The deadline to reach a spending deal passed, triggering a federal government at 12:01 a.m. Saturday. But despite a lack of official funding, many government operations will continue. Before the deadline, several agencies released revised contingency plans that included a wider scope of continuing activities than previously indicated as well as indications that plans may change depending on the shutdown’s duration.
Here are some of the government agencies and functions that will be available during shutdown and some that... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
